intro: Pseudostellaria maximowicziana, commonly known as the Chinese starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, temperate environments. The plant features delicate, star-shaped white or pink flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Pseudostellaria maximowicziana is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks in its native range.
